value.title: You thought DAX? Alex shows you Dynamic M-M-Magic!
value.excerpt: We thought that DAX was the thing in Power BI. Alex proves the M-M-Magic is really with Power Query! If you wanted to be blown away but what Power Query can do, this is the video for you! value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

If you are doing a pre-calculated rank (let‚Äôs say for an aggregated table or something like that), then it would be perhaps

value.title: Append vs Merge in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Combining two queries in Power Query or in Power BI is one of the most basic and also essential tasks that you would need to do in most of data preparation scenarios. value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. Some of the sharing methods can be used together to build a framework for sharing. In this post, I will talk about the most basic way of sharing Power BI content.

value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, I‚Äôll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: Power BI Design Tip   Design for Mobile Device
value.excerpt: Power BI is a mobile-friendly reporting solution. Every report that you generate can be viewed on the Mobile too. However, it doesn‚Äôt mean that the report is designed for mobile, or in other words; it doesn‚Äôt mean that is it a mobile report page. You have to make some changes, and take some extra considerations
